input.report:
17/01/2025, 00:00, MRI SPINE

Case History:

Reason for Request: Focal neurological deficit. Known Pediatric Stroke.

From clinical notes: Pediatric Stroke. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: acute ischemic infarct with restricted diffusion on DWI. No hemorrhagic transformation. Recommend neurology review.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 17/01/2025, 00:00

24/10/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Concussion follow-up. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Normal brain MRI for age. No intracranial abnormality. Ventricles and sulci normal. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 24/10/2025, 00:00

11/01/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Developmental delay. Known Chiari Malformation.

From clinical notes: Chiari Malformation. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: Chiari I malformation with tonsillar herniation below foramen magnum. Crowding at craniocervical junction. Recommend neurology review.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 11/01/2025, 00:00

04/09/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Headaches - routine workup. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Normal developmental myelination for stated age. No structural abnormality. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 04/09/2025, 00:00

23/08/2025, 00:00, MRI SPINE

Case History:

Reason for Request: Headaches - routine workup. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Post-viral cerebellitis - resolving. No hydrocephalus. Follow-up recommended. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 23/08/2025, 00:00

03/05/2025, 00:00, MRI SPINE

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pre-operative assessment. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Physiological enlarged subarachnoid spaces of infancy. Normal developmental variant. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Michael Taylor, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 03/05/2025, 00:00

05/01/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pre-operative assessment. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Normal EEG with age-appropriate background activity. No epileptiform discharges. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 05/01/2025, 00:00

21/03/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Pre-operative assessment. No previous neurological history.

Findings: Normal brain MRI for age. No intracranial abnormality. Ventricles and sulci normal. No intervention required. Reassurance provided.

Dr Sarah Mitchell, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 21/03/2025, 00:00

17/11/2025, 00:00, MRI SPINE

Case History:

Reason for Request: Focal neurological deficit. Known Neurodegenerative Disease.

From clinical notes: Neurodegenerative Disease. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: diffuse cerebral and cerebellar atrophy. White matter signal abnormality suggesting neurodegenerative process. Recommend neurology review.

Dr Sophie Richardson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 17/11/2025, 00:00

03/03/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Seizures. Known Moyamoya Disease.

From clinical notes: Moyamoya Disease. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: bilateral stenosis of terminal internal carotid arteries with characteristic moyamoya vessels at skull base. Recommend neurology review.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 03/03/2025, 00:00

22/06/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Macrocephaly. Known Dandy-Walker Malformation.

From clinical notes: Dandy-Walker Malformation. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: Dandy-Walker malformation with hypoplastic vermis and cystic dilation of fourth ventricle. Recommend neurology review.

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 22/06/2025, 00:00

13/07/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Headaches with red flags. Known Pediatric Stroke.

Findings: acute ischemic infarct with restricted diffusion on DWI. No hemorrhagic transformation. Recommend neurology review.

20/05/2025, 00:00, MRI SPINE

23/01/2025, 00:00, MRA HEAD

Dr Emma Wilson, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 23/01/2025, 00:00

01/10/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Macrocephaly. Known Focal Cortical Dysplasia.

From clinical notes: Focal Cortical Dysplasia. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: focal cortical dysplasia with cortical thickening and blurring of grey-white junction. Consistent with epileptogenic focus. Recommend neurology review.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 01/10/2025, 00:00

25/03/2025, 00:00, CT HEAD

26/11/2025, 00:00, MRA HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Headaches with red flags. Known Cerebral Hemorrhage.

From clinical notes: Cerebral Hemorrhage. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: acute intraparenchymal hemorrhage with surrounding vasogenic edema. No midline shift. Recommend neurology review.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 26/11/2025, 00:00

16/01/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Developmental delay. Known Hydrocephalus.

From clinical notes: Hydrocephalus. Paediatric neurology follow-up.

Findings: dilated lateral ventricles with periventricular edema consistent with hydrocephalus. Third and fourth ventricles also dilated. Transependymal CSF flow noted. Recommend neurology review.

Dr James Chen, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 16/01/2025, 00:00

15/12/2025, 00:00, MRA HEAD

Case History:

Reason for Request: Seizures. Known Dandy-Walker Malformation.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 15/12/2025, 00:00

26/12/2025, 00:00, MRI BRAIN

Case History:

Reason for Request: Altered consciousness. Known Arteriovenous Malformation.

Findings: arteriovenous malformation with feeding arteries and draining veins. No evidence of recent hemorrhage. Recommend neurology review.

Dr Rachel Patel, Consultant Paediatric Neuroradiologist 26/12/2025, 00:00
